title: How to Make Organic Carrot Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius).
steps.description: Grease two 9-inch (23-cm) glass or metal cake pans. Set the pans aside.

steps.headline: Combine the shredded organic carrots and 2 Tbsp (30 ml) organic apple juice in a medium pot.
steps.description: Heat the two ingredients over medium-high heat until the juice begins to boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, until the carrots are softened.

steps.headline: Puree the softened carrots.
steps.description: Pour the carrot and apple juice mixture into a food processor and pulse until smooth. Alternatively, you can also use a handheld blender to puree the carrots and apple juice directly inside the pot.

steps.headline: Add the organic raisins and walnuts to the carrot puree.
steps.description: Use the food processor or blender to pulse the raisins and nuts into the puree until they are finely chopped.

steps.headline: Whisk together the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Combine the organic flours, rolled grains, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large bowl. Use a whisk to thoroughly mix the ingredients together.

steps.headline: Mix the remaining apple juice, coconut oil, eggs, egg whites, and vanilla extract.
steps.description: Thoroughly whisk these wet ingredients together in a medium bowl.

steps.headline: Add the wet ingredients to the dry.
steps.description: Gradually pour the egg mixture into the flour mixture, beating the ingredients together as you add them to make it easier to combine. Beat with an electric mixer for several minutes until the mixture is smooth and no lumps remain.

steps.headline: Fold in the puree and organic crushed pineapple.
steps.description: Gradually fold the carrot and raisin puree into the cake batter, followed by the crushed pineapple. Use a rubber spatula and avoid over-mixing the batter. Over-mixing the batter at this point will make the cake too dense.

steps.headline: Pour the cake batter into the prepared pans.
steps.description: Gently shake the pans to pop any large air bubbles trapped inside the batter.

steps.headline: Bake the cake in the preheated oven.
steps.description: The cake should bake for about 35 to 40 minutes. Check for doneness by inserting a knife in the center. If it comes out clean, the cake is done.

steps.headline: Cool the cakes.
steps.description: Allow the cakes to cool for 5 minutes inside the pans. Then, scrape a butter knife around the sides of the pans to loosen the cakes and turn the cakes out onto wire racks. Let cool to room temperature.

steps.headline: Frost the cakes.
steps.description: Use organic cream cheese frosting to frost the tops of both cakes. Stack the cakes together and frost the sides, if desired.

steps.headline: Combine the organic cream cheese, unsalted butter, sour cream, and vanilla extract in a large bowl.
steps.description: Use an electric mixture to beat the ingredients together until creamy and thoroughly combined.

steps.headline: Gradually mix in the powdered sugar.
steps.description: Add the sugar to the wet ingredients 1/2 cup (115 g) at a time, beating with an electric mixer after each addition until the sugar is mixed in. Continue until all the sugar has been used.

steps.headline: Refrigerate.
steps.description: Keep the frosting refrigerated until you are ready to frost the cake.

text: Baking the Cake Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius). Grease two 9-inch (23-cm) glass or metal cake pans. Set the pans aside. Combine the shredded organic carrots and 2 Tbsp (30 ml) organic apple juice in a medium pot. Heat the two ingredients over medium-high heat until the juice begins to boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, until the carrots are softened. Puree the softened carrots. Pour the carrot and apple juice mixture into a food processor and pulse until smooth. Alternatively, you can also use a handheld blender to puree the carrots and apple juice directly inside the pot. Add the organic raisins and walnuts to the carrot puree. Use the food processor or blender to pulse the raisins and nuts into the puree until they are finely chopped. Whisk together the dry ingredients. Combine the organic flours, rolled grains, baking powder, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large bowl. Use a whisk to thoroughly mix the ingredients together. Mix the remaining apple juice, coconut oil, eggs, egg whites, and vanilla extract. Thoroughly whisk these wet ingredients together in a medium bowl. Add the wet ingredients to the dry. Gradually pour the egg mixture into the flour mixture, beating the ingredients together as you add them to make it easier to combine. Beat with an electric mixer for several minutes until the mixture is smooth and no lumps remain. Fold in the puree and organic crushed pineapple. Gradually fold the carrot and raisin puree into the cake batter, followed by the crushed pineapple. Use a rubber spatula and avoid over-mixing the batter. Over-mixing the batter at this point will make the cake too dense. Pour the cake batter into the prepared pans. Gently shake the pans to pop any large air bubbles trapped inside the batter. Bake the cake in the preheated oven. The cake should bake for about 35 to 40 minutes. Check for doneness by inserting a knife in the center. If it comes out clean, the cake is done. Cool the cakes. Allow the cakes to cool for 5 minutes inside the pans. Then, scrape a butter knife around the sides of the pans to loosen the cakes and turn the cakes out onto wire racks. Let cool to room temperature. Frost the cakes. Use organic cream cheese frosting to frost the tops of both cakes. Stack the cakes together and frost the sides, if desired. Making the Frosting Combine the organic cream cheese, unsalted butter, sour cream, and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Use an electric mixture to beat the ingredients together until creamy and thoroughly combined. Gradually mix in the powdered sugar. Add the sugar to the wet ingredients 1/2 cup (115 g) at a time, beating with an electric mixer after each addition until the sugar is mixed in. Continue until all the sugar has been used. Refrigerate. Keep the frosting refrigerated until you are ready to frost the cake. Finished.
